body.name: SZD S580 ATX Mid-Tower PC Case, Desktop Gaming Computer Chasssis, Front I/O USB Type-C Port, Dual Tempered Glass Panels, High-Airflow Perforated Top Panel, Water-Fan not Included (White)
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 1 hr 45 mins
features: Full White Design: The S580 case stands out from the crowd with its stunning white finish. Both the exterior and interior of the case are designed to match, creating a cohesive look that showcases your internal components and ARGB hardware.

Dual Chamber Layout: Unlike traditional computer cases, the S580 employs a dual chamber layout. This provides ample space for your hardware, excellent airflow and ventilation, efficient cable management, and allows you to create a visually striking build. With the rear chamber dedicated to power supply, hard drives, and cables, the main chamber remains clear for fan and radiator mounting points, giving you an unobstructed view of your important components.

Tempered Glass Panels: The S580 case features two 4mm tempered glass panels on the front and side, adding durability and a touch of elegance. These clear transparent windows are perfect for showcasing your ARGB LED lighting and the intricate construction of your internal components.

Mesh Panels: Aesthetics meet performance with the S580's metal mesh panels. The top and right side panels are designed with 1mm diameter mesh, allowing for massive airflow potential and optimal cooling.

Concentrated Airflow: The S580 is designed to maximize airflow and heat dissipation. It can accommodate up to 10 fans and supports a 360mm water cooler, ensuring your components stay cool even during intensive gaming sessions.
Please Note: The fans and complements are not included! Warm tips: Please install the bottom fans first before installing the motherboard.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: SZD S580 ATX Mid-Tower PC Gaming Case Elegent & Full Featured Super Tower;0.8mm Thickness Chassis Structure;Two Side Tempered Glass;Superior Airflow and Ventilation;Easy Cable Management;Multiple Cooling Fan placement up to 10 x 120mm;Liquid Cooling Radiators Compatibility: Top 360mm, Front 280mm and Rear 120mm.

Multiple Cooling Preference Supports a large number of fans and a 360mm water cooler for excellent heat dissipation. Top Mount I/O Ports Support USB Type-C connection and have up to 10Gbps transfer speeds. 2 Tempered Glass Panel Tempered glass panels allow you to showcase your internal components and ARGB lighting.

Motherboard Support Supports ATX / Micro-ATX / Mini-ITX motherboards. Support VGA up to 360mm in Length, CPU cooler up to 170mm in Height. Build with Your Driver Preference Support up to 2 X 3.5" HDDs + 3 X 2.5"SSDs or 1 X 3.5" HDD +4 x 2.5" SSDs; Support ATX power supply. Back Bays The front can be installed 3 X 2.5"SSDs and the back can be installed 2 X 3.5" HDDs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Fits my 7900xtx. Works well, great thermals looks nice, plenty of room for stickers or visibility. Feels sturdy. With magnetic fan mounts you can exceed the fans by a couple (I'm running 10 and I could fit 1 more).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic case for its price range.
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for my wifes build and it far exceeded expectation. I have a Lian Li 011 and this case was actually easier to work with. Tons of space for cable management, solid construction, the glass is sturdy and slides in and down to seat which i like better than my Lian Li which is rubber grommet snaps and a single screw to secure. surprisingly roomy inside, has a 280mm AIO, 6 fans and a large zotac 3070 and still doesnt look cramped at all. If id seen this case during my build id have saved a few bucks and went with this one. Highly recommend this case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great to build in, if you have building experience.
reviews.reviewText: Case is very nice for the price, has some sharp sides to it but nothing crazy, not a ton of cable space, had to take out the SSD holder for extra cable space, not hard to build just take your time, would 100% recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Before you buy!
reviews.reviewText: This is gonna be my case for the next 6 months or till I do my next maintenance. This case is not worth it to spend your money. If you want to have a budget case, Ill recommend not to get this one.The case feels way cheap. You won’t have enough space for cable management. Don’t have much routing holes for your cables. Doesn’t have any filter, so enjoy having a super dusty computer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This a good case, not easy for new builders though. The size of the case was perfect, leaves plenty of room for many fans and mid-sized CPU coolers. If placed right the fans can provide optimal airflow.Great value for what you get, the metal is on the cheaper end, but everything beyond that was fine.Plenty of screws for your parts if you’re transferring old parts into a new case. They were all in good condition.The only real difficulty that I had with this case was screwing in the ssd card, it’s a tight squeeze!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Sleek design but a little flimsy
reviews.reviewText: I chose this case for my first build. I like that it has the rubber on the cable holes but it's only on the side not on the top or bottom have not completed my build I'm just barely put in the fans and as I was putting in the back one for the exhaust that's where I feel how flimsy it was the back completely bent but I noticed it before any damage so it looks good now, as long as you don't touch it much it should be good to build in. If I'm able and remember to update this with the video or photo I will.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars GREAT for bigger GPU's
reviews.reviewText: I felt like my other case i had was too tiny for the Graphics card i had in it. I bought this case and now my 4070ti fits amazingly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: El equipo cuenta con espacio suficiente para todos los perifericos, solo me hizo falta un lugar para un HDD, ya q solo cuenta con un espacio solamente, por lo demás todo perfecto

reviews.reviewTitle: 360mm radiator does not fit on side mounts. Difficult to build in..
reviews.reviewText: I haven't even begun my build yet and have already found a problem with this case. My intent was to put a 360mm rad on both the top and side but there is absolutely no way the side mounts will take a 360mm rad.Update:If you plan to water cool your gpu then you will almost definitely need to mount it vertically. I attempted to mount mine normally but the waterblock stuck out by about 1/2" too far to put the side back on the case.The front glass panel, although designed to be removeable, can't be removed. The top part of the case overhangs the top edge of it preventing it from being removed. Although this doesn't affect the function of the case it does make it a little more difficult to build in it by limiting access.There are six passthroughs for cables however only two have any protection on the edges. This means the protective case on the wires can be cut through quite easily while you pull them through. The two larger ones (with protection) are just a little too small.The mobo sits very low in this case. If you put a rad and fans, or even just fans, on the bottom then the lower edge of and ATX mobo would be covered making plugging anything in along that edge difficult.Cable management consists of "stuff it in the back and cover it up". There are no tiedown spots like are often found it better cases.Overall: While I was able to do (almost) what I wanted to do in this case it wasn't easy. There is lots of room for improvement.
A very modular case, supports 10 fans for amazing airflow. My parts run super cool in this case

This case looks ok, but, no fans, and I think the screws are made of plastic, tried to put in a screw, and it broke off. I'm not a big man, just a skinny old goat, and I broke off a screw... go figure.
